content.description: Traverse the entire streambed wall, either direction. This option stays high through the middle of the wall, offering more holds and rests than the lower line. There Will Be Pump.
content.protection: Maybe a pad. Typically nice, flat, sandy landing.

content.description: Classic local test piece on the far left side of the roof. Pull on horizontal pockets to a blunted horn and then go left to a fairly high but easy top out with a flat landing. Traverse left  for the down climb being very careful of loos rocks and choss.
content.location: Far left side of roof, SDS start

content.description: SDS on a large hueco undercling around the middle of the wall. Trend left using pockets to a massive move to the jug at the lip. Do a couple more obligatory moves then drop off.
content.location: Around the middle of the wall, look for two low Giant hueco pockets, Huck starts on the lower left hueco and goes up and left

content.description:
Streambed is one of the main bouldering areas at the Box. It's noteworthy for its short approach, long traverse in the 5.11+ range, and fun problems with sandy landings.  Great for people with just a short amount of time to spare, whether local or passing through. 

  Most of the climbing is on the west side, a few on the east. 

  A page with route info is found here: 

infohost.nmt.edu/~bob/bould…
